alert.note: Alert for Northeast Suffolk; Southeast Suffolk (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 12 at 5:13PM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...LIGHT TO MODERATE SNOWFALL THIS EVENING... A band of light to moderate snow will move into the area between 515 PM and 545 PM. Visibilities may be quickly reduced to 1/2 to 1 mile as gusty northwest winds continue. An additional 1/2 and possibly up to 1 inch of snowfall is possible before the snow tapers off and ends this evening. Wind gusts up to 55 mph are possible with the onset of the snow, with wind gusts of 45 to 50 mph likely into tonight. A Wind Advisory remains in effect until 400 AM EDT. Temperatures in the lower to mid 30s will fall into the mid 20s this evening, with overnight lows 17 to around 20 degrees. Gusty northwest wind will produce wind chill values of 10 to 15 this evening and as low as around 5 above zero overnight. Motorists should exercise extra caution as snow develops and be prepared for rapid changes in visibility. Also, untreated surfaces may become slippery this evening as temperatures continue to fall to below freezing.
